title: Find LCD
text: The least common denominator of $$\frac{m+90}{25}$$ and $$\frac{m+30}{15}$$ is $$75$$.
speech: The least common denominator of  fraction, m plus 90, over 25,   and , fraction, m plus 30, over 15,   is  75 .
pacedSpeech: The least common denominator of   fraction, m plus 90, over 25,

title: Multiply LCD Both Sides
text: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get $$3\left(m+90\right)=5\left(m+30\right)$$.
speech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get  3 times, parentheses m plus 90,  is equal to 5 times, parentheses m plus 30,  .
pacedSpeech: Through multiplying both sides by LCD, we get   3 times,  m plus 90,  is equal to 5 times,  m plus 30,

title: Isolate $$m$$ on One side
text: We can further simplify $$3\left(m+90\right)=5\left(m+30\right)$$ to $$3m+270=5m+150$$. By subtracting $$3m$$ and $$150$$ both sides, we get $$120=2m$$. Then we divide both sides of the equation by $$2$$ and get $$m=60$$ as the final answer.
speech: We can further simplify  3 times, parentheses m plus 90,  is equal to 5 times, parentheses m plus 30,   to  3 m plus 270 is equal to 5 m plus 150 . By subtracting  3 m  and  150  both sides, we get  120 is equal to, 2 m . Then we divide both sides of the equation by  2  and get  m is equal to 60  as the final answer.
